devdoc.details: This is the base implementation and needs to be extended in order to support different usecases.

cancel(bytes32).details: Cancels a subscription (it can not be executed). It can be called by the owner or the subscriber.

cancel(bytes32,bytes).details: Cancels a subscription (it can't be executed).

params.signature: Signature generated by subscriber or owner.

constructor.details: Internal constructor (can't be instantiated), receives the token, publisher and wallet addresses. It also sets the domain separator for EIP712.

params._wallet: The address of the wallet where payments will be sent.
params.publisher: The address of the publisher/owner of the contract.

params.subscriptionHash: The hash of the subscription to execute.

params.subscriptionHashes: The hashes of the subscriptions to execute.

getActionHash(string,bytes32).details: Gets the hash that is signed to perform an operation on a subscription.

getSigner(bytes32,bytes).details: Gets the signer for a given hash and signature (using EIP712).

params.signature: The signature for the given hash.

getSigner(bytes32,bytes).return: The address recovered from the hash and the signature.

getSubscription(bytes32).details: Gets the data from a subscription.

isActive(bytes32).details: Returns if the subscription is considered active, which means that it has been executed at least once and the next payment is in the future. A subscription that is cancelled is still considered active until the end of the period.
isActive(bytes32).return: True if the subscription is active, false otherwise.

isCancelled(bytes32).details: Returns if the subscription has been cancelled.
isCancelled(bytes32).return: True if the subscription is cancelled, false otherwise.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

nextPaymentTimestamp(bytes32).details: Gets the next timestamp in which the subscription can be executed. It is possible for this method to return a timestamp in the past, so publishers need to provide a grace period because of the delay in transaction execution.
nextPaymentTimestamp(bytes32).return: The timestamp in which the subscription can be executed.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

subscriberSubscriptionByIndex(address,ui.details: Gets the subscription hash at a given index of the subscription array of a subscriber.

params.index: The index of the subscription in the subscriber's subscription array.

subscriberSubscriptionCount(address).details: Gets the number of subscriptions that haven't been cancelled for a subscriber.

subscriberSubscriptionRange(address,uint.details: Gets an array of subscription hashes given an offset and limit for a subscriber.

params.limit: Maximum amount of hashes to return
params.offset: The offset of the first hash (if any).

subscriptionByIndex(uint256).details: Gets the subscription hash at a given index of all subscriptions.

subscriptionCount().details: Gets the total number of not cancelled subscriptions.

subscriptionRange(uint256,uint256).details: Gets an array of subscription hashes given an offset and limit.

params.limit: Maximum amount of hashes to return
params.offset: The offset of the first hash (if any).

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

devdoc.title: Subscription manager base implementation.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.
